pr_title: Fix db query is not get when using scalikejdbc

timeline.bodyText: @orekyuu This seems to be the only functional change. Can you better explain how this solves the problem?
timeline.author: tylerbenson

replies.bodyText:
Before the change, the following was executed.

Call prepareStatement method in scalikejdbc.DBSession#createStatementExecutor. (https://github.com/scalikejdbc/scalikejdbc/blob/3f24bdb57af36eeb2ea636710e8845773fad19f1/scalikejdbc-core/src/main/scala/scalikejdbc/DBSession.scala#L87 )
In JDBCMaps.preparedStatements, save SQL with raw PreparedStatement as key.
DBSession wraps PreparedStatement with DBConnectionAttributesWiredPreparedStatement ( https://github.com/scalikejdbc/scalikejdbc/blob/3f24bdb57af36eeb2ea636710e8845773fad19f1/scalikejdbc-core/src/main/scala/scalikejdbc/DBSession.scala#L93 )
Get SQL using JDBCConnectionAttributesWiredPreparedStatement from JDBCMaps.preparedStatements but no value exists.

Ignoring the DBConnectionAttributesWiredPreparedStatement and using the raw PreparedStatement should work as expected. 🤔
replies.author: orekyuu

replies.bodyText: Ok, so ignoring the wrapped one allows the instrumentation to be properly applied on the "underlying" one?
replies.author: tylerbenson

replies.bodyText: When JDBCConnectionAttributesWiredPreparedStatement#execute was called, span was recorded there. However, if JDBCConnectionAttributesWiredPreparedStatement is ignored, the span will be recorded by the execute of another PreparedStatement (for example, HikariProxyPreparedStatement), so it looks like the expected behavior.
replies.author: orekyuu

timeline.message: Move unit test to scalike project.
